required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: UWCCC Precision Medicine Molecular Tumor Board Registry

brief_summary.textblock: This study seeks to evaluate the clinical utility of the Precision Medicine Molecular Tumor Board, and to track patient outcomes.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of acceptance of molecular tumor board recommendations
primary_outcome.description: How often the molecular tumor board's recommendations are accepted
Whether patients benefit from PMMTB recommended treatment

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation of mutations with protein overexpression
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate mutations identified in tumor tissue with protein overexpression

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlations of mutations with circulating tumor DNA
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate mutations identified in tumor tissue with circulating tumor DNA

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlations of mutations with spheroid culture investigations
secondary_outcome.description: Correlate mutations identified in tumor tissue with spheroid culture investigations

arm_group.description: This study of the PMMTB will include all patients >= 18 with clinically suspected or histologically confirmed solid or hematological malignancy who will undergo genetic testing of their tumor. All standard of care functions will be performed by standard procedures.

intervention.description: PMMTB is a clinical intervention, NOT a research intervention. The research component of this study is to observe the outcomes of the PMMTB.

biospec_descr.textblock:
Subjects will be asked to give one blood sample and up to two tissue samples (one at diagnossi & one at progression of treatment, which are both standard clinical procedures).
- Drawing 8 tsp of blood at the first clinic visit, DNA extraction from this blood, additional testing on this blood.
- Retention of residual tumor tissue for future research.
- Collection of residual fresh tumor tissue [that was biopsied for clinical reasons], and performing of genetic analyses/retention for future research.
- Banking of data, blood, and biopsy tissue for future research.
- Distribution of banked data/blood/biopsied tissue for research projects.

study_pop.textblock: This study will include all patients age â‰¥18 with clinically suspected or histologically confirmed solid or hematological malignancy who will undergo genetic testing of their tumor. It will require each patient to have the ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinically suspected or histologically confirmed solid or hematological malignancy
- Undergoing genetic testing of tumor
- Ability to understand written informed consent document
- Willingness to sign written informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Pediatric patients (age<18 years) will be excluded due to a lack of expertise on the molecular tumor committee

facility.name: University of Wisconsin Carbone Cancer Center

link.description: UW Carbone Cancer Center Home Page
